newsitem.title: ESTONIA: ESTONIA-KAUBAMAJA NEW SHARES TO BE AT PREMIUM.
newsitem.headline: ESTONIA-KAUBAMAJA NEW SHARES TO BE AT PREMIUM.

text.p: Retail firm Tallinna Kaubamaja is to issue its 3.4 million new shares at a premium to the market but did not say at what price the issue would be.
It earlier announced that it will propose to its annual shareholder meeting an issue of 3,394,100 new shares with a nominal value of 10 kroons.
The issue will double the company's share capital from the present 33.9 million kroons to 67.8 million kroons and will take place on May 22, the company added in a statement.
The aim of the share issue to make the company's shares more available to small investors, the company said.
The department stores' share holder general meeting will be held April 19.

Tallinna kaubamaja's audited profit for 1996 was 28.8 million kroons and the board will propose that five percent of this profit, or 1.4 million kroons, will be paid into the company's reserve capital.
The company's balance sheet on March 31 increased to 191.4 from March 1996 from 161 million kroons while tax debt increased over the same period from 2.3 million kroons to 4.2 million kroons.
The company's long-term bank loans decreased from 27.9 million kroons in March 1996 to 18.9 million kroons in March 97.
